New Records: Mayank Yadav becomes the third Indian bowler to bowl a maiden over in a Twenty20 International on debut.
Key Match Events: India defeated Bangladesh by 7 wickets in the first T20I match of the three-match series.
India chased down the target of 128 runs in just 11.5 overs, scoring 132/3.
Arshdeep Singh was awarded 'Player of the Match' for picking up 3 wickets at an economy of 3.65 and giving away just 14 runs.
Varun Chakravarthy and Arshdeep Singh took three wickets each for India.
Mayank Yadav delivered a maiden over and took his first international wicket in his debut match.
Hardik Pandya scored an unbeaten 39 runs to help India secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: India opted to field first after winning the toss.
Suryakumar Yadav emphasized the importance of backing their skills and decisions made in the team meeting.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and highlighted areas for improvement.
Bangladesh skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto acknowledged the team's poor start and emphasized the need for better planning and strike rotation in future matches.
Arshdeep Singh reflected on his performance and the importance of adapting to the situation and conditions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The second T20I match between India and Bangladesh will be played at Arun Jaitley International Stadium in Delhi on 9 October from 7 PM onwards.
The weather in Gwalior on 6 October was sunny and dry, with clear skies at night.
The pitch at Gwalior favored the batting side, making it a run fest.
